resources.string:
Hi! My name is Kirill. 
I'm an IT student at Lambton College. 

This is my solution for Developer Intern test task. I solve it in 2 ways. 
First is Greedy Algorithm that is quite fast and result satisfies the conditions. 
Second is Genetic Algorithm that can be limited in time manually (that is why it calculates pretty long time) but it is also less dependent on raw data than Greedy one. 
I don't solve the task with Brute Force and Branch and Bound Algorithms because they are not efficient for big initial raw data. And I skip Dynamic Algorithm because I don't know how it works yet :) 

Thanks for that task! I had a great time solving in during New Year break.
